SENT.plain: Cerebral venous sinus thrombosis is not a recognized complication of end-stage liver disease
A case of sagittal sinus thrombosis in a 44-year-old male with end-stage hepatic cirrhosis is described
Recurrent seizures were the only manifestation
Work-up revealed severe deficiency of protein C, protein S, and antithrombin III
He was treated with low molecular weight heparin and underwent an orthotopic liver transplant after three months
Follow-up helical CT venogram showed resolution of the sinus thrombosis
